title: Provinces to get bike lanes
text:
Provinces to get bike lanes 27 Aug 2015 at 03:47 208 viewed 0 comments NEWSPAPER SECTION: LIFE | WRITER: KARNJANA KARNJANATAWE - + The Department of Highways has launched a bike lane along road number 121, not far from Chiang Mai city. 
Called Don Kaew-Ton Phayom, the bike lane is 4.56km long and covered with asphalt. It was built along an irrigation canal starting from KM33+448 or around the junction to Huay Tung Thao to KM38+011 or around Chiang Mai International Exhibition and Convention Centre. 
Chiang Mai's new bike lane. 
In addition, the department will also build more bike lanes in three other provinces. First is a 10km-long route along road number 2034 in Mukdahan's Muang district. The route will begin at Ho Kaeo Mukdahan or the observation tower and lead to Phu Pha Thoep National Park. 
A bike lane along road number 3049 in Nakhon Nayok's Muang district, measuring 6.12km-long, will begin at the junction of Sarika Waterfall and lead to the junction at Khun Dan Prakan Chon Dam. 
The last lane will be built in Phang Nga. It will be 2.2km-long and will be built along Highway 4, in Thai Muang district. The route will lead from Khao Lak to Bang Niang. Exhibitions at airports 
Chiang Mai Airport has launched a photo exhibition to promote Lanna culture. According to airport director Wisut Chantana, the exhibition displays historical events that happened in Chiang Mai, as well as photos of the way of life in the past. 
"Many pictures are rare and this is a good opportunity for visitors to Chiang Mai to learn more about local culture," he said. All of the exhibited pictures were taken in black and white by Boonserm Satrabhaya, 87, who has the largest collection of Lanna photos taken by himself over the past 60 years. 
The exhibition is in the domestic terminal and is open until Sept 30. 
Meanwhile, Suvarnabhumi International Airport is hosting the "Celebration of Silk, The Miracle Journey" exhibition to honour Her Majesty Queen Sirikit and to help promote tourism in Thailand. 
In its 5th year, the exhibition was opened on Aug 25 where ambassadors' wives joined a fashion show with leading Thai models. The exhibition also displays samples of Thai silk clothes and products from each region, as well as tourism information on silk villages. 
The exhibition is hosted at both East and West wings of the Departure Terminal until Sept 6. Airlines update Myanmar National Airlines, formerly known as Myanmar Airways, launched its first international flight to Singapore last week. The airline flies from Yangon International Airport to Singapore Changi Airport six days a week except on Saturday and plans to offer daily flights from October. 
The airline chose Singapore over Bangkok as Singapore has better international connections, according to Myanmar Transport Minister U Nyan Htun Aunga, as reported by Myanmar Times . The airline did not want to compete with other small airlines, which have offered the route Yangon-Bangkok, he noted. 
The airline also plans to expand other international destinations, including Taiwan and Hong Kong in December. Visit www.flymna.com . Thai Airways has postponed the suspension of flight operations on the Bangkok-Rome route from Oct 26 to Feb 1 next year. 
According to airline president Charamporn Jotikasthira, the aim is to meet travel demands during high season in Rome. The route suspension is only temporary, he said, adding that the route will be reconsidered once THAI has progressed with its transformation plan and can compete with other airlines. 
THAI operates four flights per week to the capital of Italy on Monday, Wednesday, Friday and Sunday. Visit www.thaiairways.com . Hotel updates The Erawan Group will open seven more budget hotels, Hop Inn, next year. The concept of Hop Inn is a six-floor hotel with 79 rooms. A night's stay is priced from 550-650 baht, depending on locations. The hotel offers clean and compact rooms with a hot shower and in-room amenities, but excludes breakfast. The target groups are business people, especially sales teams of corporate companies and civil servants of state agencies. 
At present, Hop Inn is located in Phitsanulok, Kanchanaburi, Mae Sot, Lampang, Sa Kaeo, Nong Khai, Khon Kaen, Nakhon Ratchasima, Udon Thani, Ubon Ratchathani and Mukdahan. 
By next year, the hotels will be launched in Phitsanulok, Nakhon Si Thammarat, Trang, Surat Thani, Krabi, Roi Et and Chumphon. Visit hopinnhotel.com . Dusit International has signed a deal with Cebu-based property developer Grand Land to open Dusit Princess hotel in Cebu in the south of the Philippines. 
The hotel will be located in the North Reclamation area of Metro Cebu as part of a mixed-use development, which will also have a number of retail outlets, offices and apartments. Dusit Princess Cebu will offer 295 rooms, restaurants, meeting rooms, a gym and swimming pools. The hotel plans to open in 2018.
